item.title: Jackie add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "Each morning, before Jackie started her studies, she wrote on a clean piece of paper: Tarde venientibus ossa. To the latecomers are left the bones." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Junot Diaz
item.description: "We all dream dreams of unity, of purity; we all dream that there's an authoritative voice out there that will explain things, including ourselves. If it wasn't for our longing for these things, I doubt the novel or the short story would exist in its current form. I'm not going to say much more on the topic. Just remember: In dictatorships, only one person is really allowed to speak. And when I write a book or a story, I too am the only one speaking, no matter how I hide behind my characters." -- Junot Diaz

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "When we're afraid, we lose all sense of analysis and reflection. Our fear paralyzes us. Fear has always been the driving force behind all dictators' repression." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "You know, they say in France that translation is like a woman: she is either beautiful or faithful. " -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Jackie add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "A good [short story] would take me out of myself and then stuff me back in, outsized, now, and uneasy with the fit." -- David Sedaris
